nexttext:
where $i$ is the decomposition index. The leading instability of the superconducting channel corresponds to the eigenvalue $w_1(\Lambda)$ which is the most diverging one as the decreasing of $\Lambda$, and the homologous form factor $f_1(k)$ tells us the detailed information of superconducting order parameter, the pairing symmetry and the gap structure.


We adopt the band structure of the optimally doped 122-iron-pnictides.   The band structure is described by a five-orbital tight-binding model\cite{Graser2010},
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E1.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="V_{\Lambda,SC}(\mathbf{k},-\mathbf{k},\mathbf{p},-\mathbf{p})=\sum_{i}w_{i}(%
\Lambda)f^{*}_{i}(\mathbf{k})f_{i}(\mathbf{p})," display="block"><mrow><mrow><mrow><msub><mi>V</mi><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Λ</mi><mo>,</mo><mrow><mi>S</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>C</mi></mrow></mrow></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>𝐤</mi><mo>,</mo><mrow><mo>-</mo><mi>𝐤</mi></mrow><mo>,</mo><mi>𝐩</mi><mo>,</mo><mrow><mo>-</mo><mi>𝐩</mi></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><munder><mo largeop="true" movablelimits="false" symmetric="true">∑</mo><mi>i</mi></munder><mrow><msub><mi>w</mi><mi>i</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Λ</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><msubsup><mi>f</mi><mi>i</mi><mo>*</mo></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>𝐤</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mi>i</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>𝐩</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo></mrow></math>

prevtext:
where $i$ is the decomposition index. The leading instability of the superconducting channel corresponds to the eigenvalue $w_1(\Lambda)$ which is the most diverging one as the decreasing of $\Lambda$, and the homologous form factor $f_1(k)$ tells us the detailed information of superconducting order parameter, the pairing symmetry and the gap structure.


We adopt the band structure of the optimally doped 122-iron-pnictides.   The band structure is described by a five-orbital tight-binding model\cite{Graser2010},

<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E2.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="H_{0}=\sum_{\mathbf{k},\sigma}\sum_{a,b=1}^{5}(\xi_{ab}(\mathbf{k})+\epsilon_{%
a}\delta_{ab})c_{a\sigma}^{\dagger}(\mathbf{k})c_{b\sigma}(\mathbf{k})," display="block"><mrow><mrow><msub><mi>H</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mrow><munder><mo largeop="true" movablelimits="false" symmetric="true">∑</mo><mrow><mi>𝐤</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>σ</mi></mrow></munder><mrow><munderover><mo largeop="true" movablelimits="false" symmetric="true">∑</mo><mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>b</mi></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mn>5</mn></munderover><mrow><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><mrow><msub><mi>ξ</mi><mrow><mi>a</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>b</mi></mrow></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>𝐤</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>+</mo><mrow><msub><mi>ϵ</mi><mi>a</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>δ</mi><mrow><mi>a</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>b</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><msubsup><mi>c</mi><mrow><mi>a</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>σ</mi></mrow><mo>†</mo></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>𝐤</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>c</mi><mrow><mi>b</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>σ</mi></mrow></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>𝐤</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo></mrow></math>

<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E3.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="H_{J_{1}}=J_{1}\sum_{<i,j>}\sum_{a,b}\mathbf{S}_{ia}\cdot\mathbf{S}_{jb}," display="block"><mrow><mrow><msub><mi>H</mi><msub><mi>J</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></msub><mo>=</mo><mrow><msub><mi>J</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><munder><mo largeop="true" movablelimits="false" symmetric="true">∑</mo><mrow><mrow><mi/><mo><</mo><mi>i</mi></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mi>j</mi><mo>></mo><mi/></mrow></mrow></munder><mrow><munder><mo largeop="true" movablelimits="false" symmetric="true">∑</mo><mrow><mi>a</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>b</mi></mrow></munder><mrow><msub><mi>𝐒</mi><mrow><mi>i</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>a</mi></mrow></msub><mo>⋅</mo><msub><mi>𝐒</mi><mrow><mi>j</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>b</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo></mrow></math>
